page.title: 08BRAYDON WOODS FLORA FAUNA
page.content: Woods - Ancient Broadleaved semi- natural. Somerford Common - about 150 hectacres. Clear-felled in late 1950's 90% coniferised. Good wide flora-very important for butterflies. 34 species were recorded in 1984, including small Pearl-bordered Fritillary and Brown Hairstreak. Nightingales breed here also. 2.5 hectacres is Wiltshire Trust for Nature Conservation Reserve. The area is unconiferised. Four areas are managed in different ways e.g. coppice on 10 year cycle. Ride flora includes Pendulous Sedge, Twayblade and Greater Butterfly Orchid. Ravensroost-important wood-possibly primary i.e.woodland since last Ice Age. Large list of species includes Small-leaved Lime, Wild Service Tree and Birdsnest Orchid. 109 woodland species-35 s.region ancient indicators
